thread.title: YOU’RE ON YOUR OWN: China CLASHES with Donald Trump over North Korean nuclear weapons
thread.title_full: YOU’RE ON YOUR OWN: China CLASHES with Donald Trump over North Korean nuclear weapons

title: YOU’RE ON YOUR OWN: China CLASHES with Donald Trump over North Korean nuclear weapons
text:
GETTY Trump claimed China could put pressure on the North Korean dictatorship to end its missile programme 
Trump also claimed Beijing could intervene in Pyongyang’s affairs and influence the dictatorial regime to reign in its nuclear programme. 
But the Chinese government yesterday batted away the comments. I know exactly what's going on between China and North Korea President Donald Trump 
A foreign ministry spokesman said: “We have said many times already that the crux of the North Korean nuclear issue is the problem between the United States and North Korea. 
“We hope the relevant parties can shoulder their responsibilities, play the role they should, and together with China play a constructive role for peace and stability on the Korean peninsula and for its denuclearisation.” GETTY North Koreans are 'terrified' of war with Trump's America, it is claimed 
He added: “The Trump White House needs to make the first move and talk to Pyongyang. 
“The United States stands to lose nothing for trying this.” The most important images from North Korea's nuclear ambitions Tue, February 14, 2017 A look at North Korea's firepower as it pursues its nuclear and ballistic missile programs in defiance of the United States and its allies. REUTERS 1 of 13 Rockets are carried by military vehicles during a military parade to celebrate the centenary of the birth of North Korea's founder Kim Il-sung in Pyongyang. 
There are signs of a potential thawing of relations between the Trump administration and the hermit nation as North Korean representatives look set to come to the negotiating table with the US. 
The talks, which would be the first of their kind for more than five years, could help to restore a constructive relationship between the US and North Korea and if they go ahead then it would be the clearest sign yet that Kim Jong-un is open to talk with Washington. 
But an expert has claimed Kim Jong-un’s subjects are terrified of war with the US in the wake of Trump’s inflammatory rhetoric over North Korea. 
Following a further missile test from the North, Trump described the Communist country as a “big, big problem” that he will deal with "very strongly”. Related articles
